Intervention.evidence: patients who were provided with a smoking cessation intervention had significantly increased odds of quitting smoking by the time of surgery compared with usual care

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was smoking cessation at surgical time to the last follow-up

Result_Outcome.evidence: with a reported relative risk (95% CI) 1.64 (1.30–2.07) and at the longest follow-ups with RR (95% CI) 1.38 (1.12–1.70)

Harms.evidence: there was no difference found in the rate of postoperative complications between intervention and control conditions with RR (95% CI) 0.81 (0.62–1.06)
